jUnitTests

Class TestWinConditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • jUnitTests.TestWinConditions

  • public class TestWinConditions
extends java.lang.Object
    These tests will ensure that win condition methods are working as they should The ability for these tests to function as they should relly on the player class to be fully functional. Make sure all tests for player class pass before running these ones.
    Author:
    manu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestWinConditions() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_1()
      check if win is properly detected on the top right half of the board
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_2()
      verify a win at the most top right corner where exactly 5 pieces fit.
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_3()
      verify a win on the bottom left half of the board
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_4()
      verify a win at the most bottom left corner where exactly 5 pieces fit.
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_5()
      verify that anything over 5 in a row does not count as a win
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_6()
      verify that anything less than 5 does NOT count as a win.
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_7()
      verify that 5 not in a row does not count as a win
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_8()
      verify that 5 in a row of different colour pieces does not count as a win
      void testVerifyDiagonalLeft_9()
      This test replicates a bug that was found during front end testing see screenshot 001.png in 'res/bugscreenshot' folder
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_1()
      check if win is properly detected on the top left half of the board
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_2()
      verify a win at the most top left corner where exactly 5 pieces fit.
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_3()
      verify a win on the bottom right half of the board
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_4()
      verify a win at the most bottom right corner where exactly 5 pieces fit.
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_5()
      verify that anything over 5 in a row does not count as a win
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_6()
      verify that anything less than 5 does NOT count as a win.
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_7()
      verify that 5 not in a row does not count as a win
      void testVerifyDiagonalRight_8()
      verify that 5 different pieces in a row does not count as a win
      void testVerifyHorrizontal_1()
      Test verify horizontal detects a win (5 in a row of same colour)
      void testVerifyHorrizontal_2()
      Test that anything over 5 in a row is NOT counted as a win
      void testVerifyHorrizontal_3()
      test that anything less than 5 is not a win
      void testVerifyHorrizontal_4()
      test that a 5 pieces separated by empty square is NOT a win
      void testVerifyHorrizontal_5()
      test that a 5 pieces in a row NOT of the same colour is NOT a win
      void testVerifyVeritcle_1()
      same as testVerrifyHorrizontal_1
      void testVerifyVeritcle_2()
      same as testVerrifyHorrizontal_2
      void testVerifyVerticle_3()
      same as testVerrifyHorrizontal_3
      void testVerifyVerticle_4()
      same as testVerrifyHorrizontal_4
      void testVerifyVerticle_5()
      test that a 5 pieces in a row NOT of the same colour is NOT a win
